move for the world's largest stablecoin issuer: Tether has successfully registered the Hadron trademark in the Russian Federation! The application, filed in October 2025, was approved by Rospatent (Russia's Federal Service for Intellectual Property) in January 2026, granting exclusive rights until October 3, 2035.

This covers blockchain financial services, crypto trading/exchange, payment processing, and advisory perfect for Hadron's focus on real world asset (RWA) tokenization.

Quick recap on Hadron by Tether (launched November 2024):
User friendly platform for tokenizing stocks, bonds, commodities, loyalty points, real estate, funds, and more.
Turns physical/digital assets into liquid, blockchain based tokens with strong compliance (KYC/KYB/KYT), security, and global accessibility.
Aims to democratize tokenized assets for institutions, governments, businesses, and beyond.

Timing is spot-on: Russia is gearing up for major crypto/stablecoin/RWA regulations in the first half of 2026 (post-2025 policy softening), including updates to digital financial assets (DFAs) laws. This trademark positions Tether/Hadron for potential entry into a market that's already Europe's largest by crypto transaction volume ($376B July 2024‚ÄìJune 2025).

With USDT's $187B market cap dominating stablecoins, this signals Tether's push into regulated RWA expansion in emerging/evolving jurisdictions.
